alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Morton; Stanton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 7:08PM CDT by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON... NORTHWESTERN MORTON AND STANTON COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM CDT/730 PM MDT/... At 707 PM CDT/607 PM MDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near The Saunders Elevator to 8 miles east of Stonington to 15 miles northwest of Elkhart. Movement was northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... The Saunders Elevator around 715 PM CDT. Manter around 725 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Johnson City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
